name: Zhaofei Yu
content: Zhaofei Yu Zhaofei Yu Assistant Professor School of Artificial Intelligence National Engineering Research Center of Visual Technology Peking University Beijing, China. 100871. Office: Room 2728, Science 2 Buildings Email: yuzf12 αt pku dοt edu dοt cn Biography I'm an Assistant Professor of the School of Artificial Intelligence at Peking University, and I am heading the Brain-inspired Vision Lab. I received the B.S. degree from the Hong Shen Honors School, College of Optoelectronic Engineering, Chongqing University, China, in 2012 and the Ph.D. degree from the Automation Department, Tsinghua University, China, in 2017. From Sep. 2015 to Sep. 2016, I visited Prof. Wolfgang Maass's group at Graz University of Technology as a visiting student. Research Interests My research interests cover biological and computer vision, neuromorphic computation, and computational neuroscience. I am interested in learning and inference of spiking neural networks, and vision information processing based on neuromorphic visual sensors. I am also interested in extracting meaningful information embedded in high-dimensional neuroscience data and explaining how the visual system implements encoding and decoding. Opening We are looking for highly motivated students to join our group. Our group has opening positions for Ph.D. and Undergraduate Internship. If you are interested in researching on brain-like computing, please send me an email with your CV. We are hiring highly motivated postdocs to join our group through the Boya Postdoctoral Fellowship at Peking University. Please send an email with your CV and Research Statement.
